title: Calling shap_interaction_values changes explainer's expected value
body:
Hi,

I was struggling to understand why my SHAP interaction values did not add up the original SHAP value, when I realized the expected value changed after I called shap_interaction_values.

Maybe I am doing something wrong ? But I thought the expected value was dependent on the model only, irrespective of the multiple call to the shap package.

Here is a minimal working code
```
import shap  # version '0.35.0'
from xgboost import XGBClassifier  #version '1.1.1'

X, y = shap.datasets.adult()
classifier=XGBClassifier().fit(X[:100],y[:100])

booster = classifier.get_booster()  #quick fix to avoid the error utf-8 error - Issue #1260
model2 = booster.save_raw()[4:]
booster.save_raw = lambda: model2

explainer = shap.TreeExplainer(booster,data=X[:100],feature_perturbation='tree_path_dependent')

print(explainer.expected_value) #-2.674181187771028
originalSHAP_XGBoost_pars_tree = explainer.shap_values(X[100:200])
print(explainer.expected_value) #-2.674181187771028
originalSHAP_XGBoost_pars_i = explainer.shap_interaction_values(X[100:200])
print(explainer.expected_value) #-1.3913759
```
Thanks in advance !
